author: LightFykki

text:
@Arc13 
I'm sorry, I'm just trying to figure out where did SupraDarky said that nor even hinted that.
All I see was that he's glad to see her once again and that it sucks she was gone in the storyline [that made her disappear for a couple series]....
Also I do think that the storyline gives more sense to the game... Who and what our character backgrounds are, why are they fighting, and those other stuff... 
Of course I'm not looking for storylines for this; hell, I fight a block of wood.
author: skyjlv

text: excellent choice man, brings me way back.
author: TangerineGroovin

text: @skyjlv That's what I figured. What I'm saying is it's rather poor of an idea for Namco to go removing characters to stick with the plot that almost no one is seriously playing the games for. Sure, she was killed, but I don't think too many people would complain "Why is she in this game? She died in the last one!" if it means having a well balanced, fun to play fighting game. That's what I meant, and I had figured he'd just like a fight in a fighting game rather than "story comes first!"
author: Arc13

text: @SupraDarky Since when did we play fighting games for their story? It's a nice side bonus to have, but good characters with good gameplay should come first and foremost in a fighting game.
